summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 3, 2019, discussing operational planning and travel authorization for the imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. It outlines a two-wave deployment of agents to Florida to serve subpoenas to co-conspirators and interview victims, while emphasizing the need to keep this investigation separate from the 2008 Miami case.

events.title: FBI Operational Planning for Epstein Arrest
events.description: Internal FBI email chain discusses and approves operational travel plans for the imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, including deploying agents to Florida in two waves to serve subpoenas to co-conspirators and interview victims.

events.title: Previous Miami Investigation
events.description: The email references a previous investigation into Epstein in Miami from 2008, and states the current SDNY investigation must be kept separate from it, indicating a desire to avoid using agents from the Miami field office.

keyFacts: The FBI was in advanced operational planning for the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein as of July 3, 2019.

The plan involved a two-wave deployment of agents to Florida: first to serve subpoenas to co-conspirators immediately after arrest, and second to conduct 'knock and talk' interviews with victims a few days later.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) investigation was to be kept deliberately separate from the prior 2008 Miami investigation, including by not using agents from the Miami field office.
An Expenditure Authorization Number (EAN # 458015.1) was requested and approved for the operational travel expenses.
